page.title: 16Chickney, scientific vacuum
page.content: Little in the way of advanced science and technology touches the lives of residents in the Chickney area. Most farmers use modern machinery such as combine harvesters, tractors, ploughs and harrows and vacuum pipes for the transferring of grain from farm trailers to storage silos have been installed at Pinewood Farm. Crop spraying is done by the use of boom- sprays fixed to tractors by aerial methods. There is a radio station at Sibleys, where work for the government takes place, part of which is the relaying of Anglia Television programmes to the areas north of Essex. This station is connected to the Post Office Tower in London.
